page.title: 06Wildlife around Thurso
page.content: There is a wide variety of different species of animals, birds and insects The birds can be divided into seabirds moorland and garden birds. Along the seashore gather oystercatchers, terns, herring and blackheaded gulls, red- shanks, sandpipers and turnstones. On the bank of the Thurso River nest swans, ducks and dippers, coots and moorhens. Over moorland to the west of the town we find curlews, pied wag- tails, hawks, shochads (green plovers) and barn owls. Birds which frequent the gardens are sparrow, robin, finch, blackbird, dove and bluetit. Thrushes feed on snails and worms while yellow wagtails eat insects & ground beetles. At Linties Pool there are tadpoles, frogs, toads and water creatures. In and around this area are shrews, mice, rabbits, moles, voles, hedgehogs, stoats, weasels, rats, hares & foxes.
